### Recent News

The **Spurs are riding a six-game winning streak**, including victories over the Golden State Warriors (126-113) and Los Angeles Lakers (136-108)[2]. San Antonio holds a **38-16 record**.

The **Suns suffered a recent loss to the Oklahoma City Thunder (109-136) on February 11**, following a victory against the Dallas Mavericks (120-111)[2]. Phoenix stands at **32-23**.

**Head-to-head:** The Suns have dominated the season series, winning both previous matchups against the Spurs (130-118 on February 2 and 111-[score incomplete] on November 23)[2].

**Key player availability concerns:** Both teams face significant roster challenges. The Suns are particularly impacted by potential absences of **Devin Booker** (ankle) and **Grayson Allen** (knee), both listed as questionable[3]. The Spurs' injury depth is more extensive, with multiple players unavailable due to health concerns and G League assignments[2].

### Player & Team News
# Player-Focused News Report: Suns @ Spurs

## Player Form & Streaks

**San Antonio Spurs:** Victor Wembanyama continues to lead the Spurs' balanced offensive attack, averaging 24.4 points per game alongside 11.1 rebounds.[3] The Spurs are riding their longest winning streak of the season at six consecutive victories, including five wins by double digits.[6] De'Aaron Fox is projected to contribute 18 points and 6 assists in tonight's matchup.[1]

**Phoenix Suns:** The Suns have struggled recently, dropping four of their past six games before the break, including a 136-109 home loss to Oklahoma City.[6] Devin Booker leads the team at 25.2 points per game and is projected for 24 points tonight.[1][3]

## Returning Players & Ramp-Ups

Grayson Allen is not listed on the injury report ahead of Thursday's game against the Spurs, clearing any concerns about his availability.[3]

## Matchup Storylines

The Spurs are seeking a breakthrough after losing three straight games to the Suns in their recent head-to-head series.[3] San Antonio's balanced scoring attack, with seven teammates scoring in double digits, will test Phoenix's defense as the Suns attempt to reverse their recent slide and maintain their playoff positioning in the Western Conference.[6]
